snippet: A panel said the United Nations failed to meet its own standards in investigating allegations of the abuse of boys by French soldiers in the Central African Republic.
abstract: United Nations failed to process allegations of child sexual abuse by its peacekeepers in Central African Republic, according to independent investigation; scandal is latest in series which cast doubt on UN's primary mission of protecting innocent civilians; report suggests UN bureaucratic dysfunction contributed to inaction.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and RICK GLADSTONE

lead_paragraph: A panel said the United Nations failed to meet its own standards in investigating allegations of the abuse of boys by French soldiers in the Central African Republic.

headline.main: Report Criticizes U.N.’s Handling of Child Sex Abuse Allegations
headline.print_headline: Scathing Report Assails U.N. Handling of Child Sexual Abuse Allegations

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
